review_title: Fun place to work but nothing beyond that
job_title: Assistant Manager in Preston, North West England, England
pros: Can be a fun job if you have the right staff but that is not guaranteed
cons:
Long hours, shift work so no work-life balance, always short staffed so no one can be sick even during the pandemic you are forced to work when unwell
No career progression, manager is the highest you can go to and after that it's head office where you will always be seen as underqualified for because you "just work in a gym"
The pay is awful and not worth the effort you have to put in due to being short staffed

pros: Free Membership for all the staff
cons: Unfair management team - all best friends

pros: Other lifeguards are lovely people and nice to work with. Duty managers are friendly and understanding.
cons: Duty managers are brilliant but venue managers etc let the power get to there head and abuse it.

job_title: Lifeguard in Burton upon Trent, England
pros: Business is going well out of lockdown

review_title: company letting down both customers and staff
pros: If your looking for flexible part time work then there's always hours going as they are always short staffed
cons:
Reduced staff to the bare minimum and rely on a lot of casuals which then causes frequent occasions were staff can not take their breaks.
Company take for granted their members customer base and continuously prioritise new customers over existing and loyal ons.
High turn over of staff due to a combination of relying on zero hour contracts to much and poor communication between higher management and staff on the ground.

review_title: alright money, great place to make friends, terrible management
pros: the money was quite good alongside is salary, staff are friendly, free gym/swim/classes yourself and reduced membership for family and friends, the staff are always up for a night out. My direct line manager was amazing and has become a true friend and always made sure we were OK, planned all the leaving dos and birthday meals
cons:
do not expect to be respected, hours are long and sometimes when I counted them I had somehow worked extra without pay and had to fight for this to be resolved, the rota is not checked by management and many days the office is unmanned and then the sales staff are reprimanded for not coming in extra (on top of our 48 hour weeks) or for not hitting that days target, management will turn against you if you point out something they should not being doing (I was pulled in for meetings over stupid things like spelling a name wrong by accident - because my manager thought I was leaving when I asked for a reference to a job but I had not given a notice, so this was bullying)

no organisation (if an event is happening it gets planned and announced 2 days before and the staff are last to know, managers expect you to have them on facebook to keep updated which is unprofessional and an invasion of private life), they had months to plan for the data protection change but still managed to leave everything until after the act was brought in i.e we were doing things illegally for a few days 

never thank you for your work, punish staff by sending them to sites that are falling apart and then expecting the same sales results, they always promise things but get around it by not putting it explicitly in writing so I always had to get things printed out in emails to cover me and my team's back. There has been more than one occasion that management have gone home ten minutes before a meeting and left the staff sitting around waiting, managers have said things that are unprofessional and then denied it (i.e have spread gossip), emails are left unanswered for weeks, rotas are changed without consultation, don't expect to get every other weekend off like you are meant to because you will be made to work every single one somehow

pros: Loved the people I worked with
cons: Minimum wage for some people whilst others of the same age and same qualification were on higher, constantly under staffed which meant long hours on poolside, management under constant change, unorganised, rota would change without your knowledge and you won't be informed if your shift had moved (it was a paper rota so could only see it when on shift at weekends)
